message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SI. 

The paper proposes a data-driven framework for optimizing privacy-preserving data release mechanisms using adversarially-trained neural networks. This involves implementing randomized mechanisms and performing a variational approximation of mutual information privacy. The paper focuses on the tradeoff between minimizing distortion of useful data and concealing sensitive information. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
